meanings.definition: Not showing variation in form according to grammatical categories such as tense, number, or case.
meanings.sent1: The robot's speech was uninflected, always sounding the same.
meanings.sent2: The uninflected tone of the teacher's voice made it hard to tell if she was happy or sad.
meanings.sent3: The uninflected alarm clock beeped monotonously, driving everyone crazy.
meanings.sent4: Her uninflected expression revealed nothing about her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The uninflected landscape stretched endlessly, devoid of any distinguishing features.

meanings.sent1: The uninflected line on the graph remained straight throughout.

meanings.sent4: The uninflected melody lacked the emotional depth the composer intended.
meanings.sent5: The uninflected painting had a stark beauty, devoid of any embellishments.
